unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Festive Fare – Will it Leave Us Burping or Begging for More?**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood's Festive Fare – Will it Leave Us Burping or Begging for More?**

unnormalised: Mumbai – This Onam weekend, Bollywood is serving up a buffet of releases, hoping to entice audiences like piping hot biryani on a rainy day. Three films are vying for your attention and, more importantly, your Rs. 300 movie ticket.
normalised: Mumbai – This Onam weekend, Bollywood is serving up a buffet of releases, hoping to entice audiences like piping hot biryani on a rainy day. Three films are vying for your attention and, more importantly, your rupees three hundred movie ticket.

unnormalised: First, we have "Prem ki Problem," a romantic comedy starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor. Early reviews suggest it's as predictable as your uncle's political rants at Diwali.
normalised: First, we have "Prem ki Problem," a romantic comedy starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor. Early reviews suggest it's as predictable as your uncle's political rants at Diwali.

unnormalised: Then there’s “Dhoom Dhadaka Returns,” the fifth installment of the action franchise where gravity seems optional and cars fly further than pigeons near Marine Drive. Expect explosions, illogical stunts and Hrithik Roshan’s abs making a guest appearance (via CGI, probably).
normalised: Then there’s “Dhoom Dhadaka Returns,” the fifth installment of the action franchise where gravity seems optional and cars fly further than pigeons near Marine Drive. Expect explosions, illogical stunts and Hrithik Roshan’s abs making a guest appearance (via C G I, probably).

unnormalised: Finally, the indie darling, "Auto Raja’s Second Innings," a poignant story about a Bangalore auto driver trying to win back his beloved. Word on the street is it's actually good. But, you know, good doesn't always sell in this town.
normalised: Finally, the indie darling, "Auto Raja’s Second Innings," a poignant story about a Bangalore auto driver trying to win back his beloved. Word on the street is it's actually good. But, you know, good doesn't always sell in this town.

unnormalised: Analysts predict “Dhoom Dhadaka Returns” will zoom past the others, reaching the coveted Rs. 100 crore mark in record time, despite logic taking a backseat somewhere around Juhu beach. Place your bets, folks! May the best film (or the loudest one) win!
normalised: Analysts predict “Dhoom Dhadaka Returns” will zoom past the others, reaching the coveted rupees one hundred crore mark in record time, despite logic taking a backseat somewhere around Juhu beach. Place your bets, folks! May the best film (or the loudest one) win!
